snippet: Opponents of the bill vetoed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had said it would force school districts to pay for far more students to attend religious schools.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo vetoes bill that would have required public schools to consider the home environment and family background when placing special education students into schools; Cuomo says bill would have created an overly broad and ambiguous mandate to send more students to private schools, and would have given religious parents more power to demand that the public pay for private education.
lead_paragraph: Opponents of the bill vetoed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo had said it would force school districts to pay for far more students to attend religious schools.

headline.seo: Cuomo Vetoes Bill on Placement of Special Education Students
headline.main: Cuomo Vetoes Bill on Placement of Special Education Students
headline.print_headline: Bill Vetoed On Placing Students In Schools
